message.body: Goodmorning my friend, how are you today?
Hi! I'm doing great today. It's such a beautiful day i can't help it. :)
Oh brilliant :) im glad to hear youre doing well. What are your plans for today? Enjoying the weather i presume?
Well i may go out later but right now i'm working around the house. And you?
Work unfortunately :/ too much to do. i would like to go biking later if i have time though
That sounds nice. I hope you find time for it.
Do you like exercising?
I go to the gym maybe once or twice a month.
Well i try to ride my bike as much as possible, but i dont really go to the gym or any of that. Never really liked the idea, to be completely honest.
Why did you send me a text in french? I understand french but it just surprised me.
Where are you from?
ing in philadelphia. What about you, where are you from?
Oh sorry x.x that was for someone else. My boyfriend is learning french and im trying to help him along. Im from england originally but right now im liv
Your message arrived incomplete. I only saw the second part. I'm from phila. I travel a lot though. Is your name dutch?
Oops x.x not having much luck are we haha. Im from england living in philadelphia. And rhosymedre is welsh actually. Where have you travelled to?
Oh i see. Is your family welsh?
I was born in phila and my mother's side is from here.
My father's side is from the caribbean. I'm culturally mixed.
I guess i inherited my mother's love for foreign cultures.
I have been to london brussels nice barcelona and lisbon in europe
I've been to canada and mexico and brazil
I've also been to 4 islands in the caribbean.
Oh thats brilliant! I wish i were like that, my dad is from wales and my mum is from france.
I've been to mexico 10 times and i was living there on and off for 4 years.
I dont speak welsh though. Rhosymedre is the name of a hymn my dad used to hum to me before bed
I am now fluent in spanish and portuguese and i'm learning french and italian.
Im not as well travelled as you either i guess, ive been around europe but i dont suppose that counts. This is my first time living away from home
What part of france?
That's a pretty word. I wish i knew how to pronounce it
What part of england are you from?
How long have you been in philly?
Ah, j'aime le francais! I want to learn welsh at some point but right now im learning japanese. I can speak esperanto too, but thats not very useful haha
I was learning japanese too for a little while but i didn't get very far.
Is french your first language?
My mum is from lyon, south of paris and northwest of nice. I was born in london but lived in kent most of my life
Muzukasii nihongo desu nee! I grew up speaking english but i did pick up french from my mum, my dad doesnt speak french
And thank you :) rhosymedre is pronounced ro-seh-meh-dreh
Ah cool! What did you say in nihon? That's japanese for japanese right?
Thanks for the pronunciation!
Nihongo is japanese language (nihon or nippon is japan), and i said that japanese is hard xD i enjoy japanese though, im taking a writing class currently
And ive been in philly for around two years now, im in university here
Is it creative writing? In English?
Do you want to stay after you graduate?
Oh - no, a japanese writing class. Kanji and all that.
Although i would like to take a creative writing class before i graduate
I do enjoy america, i very well might stay after uni. Although it is rather far from home
That's awesome. I learned hiragana and some katakana but no kanji. Seems hard.
Maybe you could convince your family to come here. :)
Are you taking the japanese class at your school?
Hiragana and katakana are easy, i learnt them in two weeks. Kanji take more practice but if you put the effort in its rather easy too
Ahaha, maybe my brother could be convinced but im sure most of my family is quite pleased with where they are now
I am. Its incredibly helpful
I guess i would need a good teacher. I was teaching myself and kanji may be easier if i learned some of the rules or patterns.
Lol. Oh well. It was worth a shot!
Hold on a sec. I'll be back in a few minutes.
Ive found furigana to be incredibly helpful learning to read kanji
Although actually learning to write kanji you might want help, stroke order is so so important
Okay. Take your time
What is furigana?
Sorry, i had class until just now. Furigana is kanji with the pronunciation spelled out in hiragana above it. Totemo benri desu yo :3
What does that sentence mean?
Its very convinient
How long have you studied Japanese?
I think it was no more than a month or so that i had played around with it. I should take classes.
I start work in 15 minutes. I work till 10 tonight so i may have to table the conversation till tomorrow morning ok?
Ive been studying for about five months,it gets easier once you start to understand the sentence structure
Okay, do what you gotta do
What does anata no watashi wa gozaimas desu ka mean? I remember those words but i don't remember how to make a sentence using them. That's about the exte
nt of what i learned.
My client is late so i guess i have a few more minutes.
If i stop texting it's because he arrived.
Okay, its all good mate
What did i say in japanese out of curiosity?
Anata no watasi wa gozaimas desu ka? Well anata = you, watasi = i, no is a connector word but it usually works in the same context as the word one in the phrase
" i want that one "
Gozaimasu is a verb which essentially means to have, and desu ka is a phrase that indicates a question
And wa is a particle that assigns importance within a sentence. As for the meaning, you cant form a coherent sentence with those words, its just nonsense
Lol ok thanks!
Good morning!
Morning, and how are you on this fine day?
Great! I'm off to a productive day.
And you? How has your morning been so far?
